DOC.brief_summary: Open pilot study of peanut oral immunotherapy in 22 children with peanut allergy
DOC.brief_title: Study of Tolerance to Oral Peanut
DOC.detailed_description: Background Peanut allergy is severe and rarely resolves. Objective To test the efficacy and safety of a new oral immunotherapy protocol for peanut allergy. Method 22 peanut-allergic children will undergo oral challenge. Oral immunotherapy will be administered by gradual updosing with 2-weekly increments (8-38w) to 800mg protein (5 peanuts/day) followed by 30-weeks maintenance. Oral challenge will be repeated after 6 and 30 weeks maintenance.
DOC.criteria: Peanut allergy defined by oral challenge Major immunodeficiency
